Best Answer - Chosen by Asker At Mcdonalds there are service and grill workers- and some people who have been cross-trained know both. Positions are- Service: Cashier, Drive thru Cashier, Drive thru Presenter, Runner for Counter and a Runner for Drive Thru, a Fry or Hashbrown Person. For Grill: Meats person, Initiator, Assembler(also known as table worker). As for which is easier grill or service- they both have their ups and downs. Some days it is easier to work service, some days grill. You have to do more physical work in grill, but you have to deal with customers up front- they even out:) Also there are managers of varying degrees Source(s): Work at Mcdonalds;) 4 years ago Report Abuse Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: ty Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Member since: June 28, 2008 Total points: 400 (Level 2) Add Contact Block Well I work at McDonalds, and there are 2 main positions, counter and grill. They might be a little different at taco bell or burger king, but I'm sure it's the same idea.
Grill is making the food for front counter and drive through.
Front counter is when you take orders and put them together inside, or take orders and pass them out to drive thru.
And there are also the managers, who are assigned to a certain position, like production or keeping track of the workers and when they need breaks.
